oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dog Effigy Pot
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This clay image of a dog is also a spouted vessel.

This effigy pot may be the same one used for the embossed image on the cover of The Antiquities of Tennessee, 1890, by General Gates P. Thruston, which was the first published book on Native American excavations in Middle Tennessee. Thruston donated his extensive collection of artifacts excavated in the Middle Tennessee area to Vanderbilt University. The collection is now on extended loan to the Tennessee State Museum.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Building a Future Through Opportunity
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Images reproduced on this website are intended for individual, educational use only. For research inquiries about specific objects or requests for high resolution images, contact the Tennessee State Museum.
